msDesc.head: Liber septem partium, etc. Germany, xii2.

msItem.note: This description is abbreviated from Daniela Mairhofer, Medieval Manuscripts from the Mainz Charterhouse in the Bodleian Library, Oxford: A Descriptive Catalogue (Oxford, 2018), pp. 1359–1367. For purposes of scholarly citation, reference to the printed catalogue is requested.

msItem.title: Liber Septem Partium
msItem.note: With prologue and list of chapters to each part (unpr.; R.-M. Martin, ‘La nécessité de croire au mystère de l’incarnation’, Revue Thomiste, nouv. sér. 3/11 (1920) 273–80, citing the present MS. at pp. 274f.; F. Stegmüller, ‘Sententiae Berolinenses. Eine neugefundene Sentenzensammlung aus der Schule des Anselm von Laon’, RThAM 11 (1939) 33–61, at p. 35 (no. xiv), this copy; Stegmüller, RS, 793, citing the present MS.; Landgraf, Einführung, 36f., with a list of MSS at p. 36, this copy). The present manuscript is the oldest surviving copy to contain this anonymously transmitted collection of quotations from the Church Fathers. It is also preserved in MS. Paris, BnF, Lat. 16528, for example.

msItem.author: Ps.-Bede
msItem.title: Homiliae evangelii 3. 55, In natali divae Mariae virginis
msItem.note: (ed.: PL 94. 413D–16A; D. Hurst (ed.), CCSL 122 (1955) 382; CPL 1368) = Alcuin, Interpretationes nominum Hebraicorum (ed.: PL 100. 725A–28C; – Stegmüller, RB, 1094); end shortened.

msItem.author: Ps.-Augustine
msItem.title: De paenitentia (serm. 393)
msItem.note: (ed.: PL 67. 1082B–83B, hom. 19; PL 39. 1713–15, serm. 393; = Caesarius of Arles?, serm. 63)

msItem.author: Ps.-Bede
msItem.title: Interpretatio Sibyllinorum verborum
msItem.note: Variant text with De quindecim signis diei iudicii (ed.: PL 94. 555B–D; Gerhardt & Palmer, Fünfzehn Zeichen, 61; BHM 652). See MS. Laud Misc. 493, fols 10v–11r.

msItem.author: Walahfrid Strabo
msItem.title: Homilia in initium evangelii s. Matthaei
msItem.note: (ed.: PL 114. 849D–62A (= Pez, Thes., 2. 41–56; Stegmüller, RB, 8326). Binding error (see Collation): the text ends at fol. 81v, continues on fols 84r–85v, and again on fol. 82r–v.

msItem.title: Patristic extracts
msItem.note: Excerpts, from Augustine, Jerome, Anselm of Laon, etc., followed by several texts, mainly quaestiones; some of these are unidentified, others form part of the Sententiae Anselmi.

supportDesc.support: parchment; (fol. 1) the endleaf of different quality (fragment); occasional natural flaws and holes, (fol. 57) remnants of medieval repair (stitching holes). (fols 2r, 84r–87v) Several rust stains from previous binding furniture, the leaves at the end of the volume show marks from one or two fore-edge clasps/straps.
supportDesc.collation: i 1+8 | ii–x 8 | xi 2 | xii 4. The sequence of text (see Contents) suggests a binding error: what is now quire xi should have been the innermost bifolium of the last quire: quires xi & xii should originally have formed a trinion, consisting of (inwardly) fols 84/87, 85/86 & 82/83; this would also explain that there is no quire signature at the end of quire xi. Quire signatures at the bottom centre of the last verso of quires ii–x, in roman numerals, starting with ‘.ii.’ on fol. 17v, the end of quire ii.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruling (fols 2r ff.) in hard point, one column of 38–41, mostly 40 lines. Ruled space c.171–176 84–93

handDesc.handNote: protogothic script, Germany (or somewhere very close to the German border), s. xii2, several hands, above top line.

decoDesc.decoNote: Marginal sketches: (fol. 2r) remnants, at the top right corner; (fol. 11r) a small lion; (fol. 24r) a similar sitting beast.

binding.p: Brown tanned calf over laminated pulpboard for Archbp. Laud, 1637–1639

history.provenance: Mainz, Carthusian abbey of St Michael: the late 14th-cent. ex-libris inscriptions at the upper margin of fol. 2r, following the title: ‘Incipit liber septem parcium. Fratrum Cartusiensium | prope mogunciam’ and, in the same hand, at the upper margin of fol. 87v: ‘Fratrum Cartusiensium prope mogunciam’ (boxed in). Identifiable as G XVI T in cat. ii.
William Laud, 1573–1645: Ex-libris inscription of Archbp. Laud, dated 1638, at the lower margin of fol. 2r.
history.acquisition: Given to the Bodleian as part of his third donation, dispatched on 28 June 1639.

recordHist.source: See above. Previously described in the Quarto Catalogue (H. O. Coxe, Laudian Manuscripts, Quarto Catalogues II, repr. with corrections, 1969, from the original ed. of 1858–1885). Decoration, localization and date follow Pächt and Alexander (1966). Quarto Catalogue, cols. 371–2 Quarto Catalogue, p. 567 Quarto Catalogue, p. 568 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 1, p. 46

listBibl.head: Published descriptions:
listBibl.bibl: Daniela Mairhofer, Medieval Manuscripts from the Mainz Charterhouse in the Bodleian Library, Oxford: A Descriptive Catalogue, 2 vols. (Oxford, 2018), pp. 1359–1367

msItem.title: Legal fragment
msItem.note: Fragment of interrogatories in a law suit. For full description, see printed catalogue.

revisionDesc.change: Description revised for Mainz digitization project to include additional information from Mairhofer catalogue.
